com.quest.glue.api.services
Interface TopologyValue

public interface TopologyValue

Represents a single value in a topology tree.

Since:
5.5.5

Method Summary

          The name of this value.

Method Detail

getName

java.lang.String getName()
The name of this value.

Returns:
The name of this value.

getValueBoolean

java.lang.Boolean getValueBoolean()
Returns the current node value as a boolean, or Boolean.FALSE if the current text value cannot be converted to a boolean using Boolean.parseBoolean(String). Boolean values are stored internally as text.

Returns:
The boolean value for this node or Boolean.FALSE if the node does not contain a recognized boolean value.
See Also:
setSampleValue(Boolean)

getValueDate

java.util.Date getValueDate()
Returns the current node value as a Date or null if the current value cannot be converted to a date. Dates are stored internally as numeric timestamps.

Returns:
The Date value for this node, or null if the node does not contain a recognized date value.
See Also:
setSampleValue(Date)

getValueFrequency

long getValueFrequency()
Returns the sample rate set for this value. If no rate has been set, 0 will be returned and the node will inherit its sample rate from its parent.

Returns:
the sample rate for this value, or 0 if not rate has been defined.

getValueNumber

java.lang.Number getValueNumber()
Returns the numeric value for this element, or null if no numeric value has been set.

Returns:
The numeric value for this element.

getValueText

java.lang.String getValueText()
Returns the current text value for this element, or null if no text value has been set.

Returns:
The text value for this node.

getValueTimestamp

long getValueTimestamp()
Returns the timestamp associated with this value, or 0 if this value does not have its own timestamp, but instead inherits that of its parent.

Returns:
the timestamp for this value, or 0 if the value inherits its timestamp.

isIdentity

boolean isIdentity()
Whether or not this node or value represents an identity property.

Returns:
true if this node of value represents an identity property and false if it does not.

isReplace

boolean isReplace()
Whether or not the current node will replace (true) or append to (false, default) existing values in the server.

Returns:
true if the value will replace any existing and false if it will not.
Since:
5.5.5.1

setIsIdentity

void setIsIdentity(boolean is_identity)
Provides a hint to the server side processing code that this value represents an identity property in the topology types definition.

Nodes and values that represent identity properties will be submitted to the CDT by the FglAM server-side code every time they are encountered in the topology. Nodes and values that are not marked as identity will only be submitted to the CDT the first time they are encountered.

Parameters:
is_identity - whether or not this node represents an identity property.

setReplace

void setReplace(boolean replace)
For topology attributes that are marked as "is-many", setting replace to true will cause the server to replace any existing values with those contained in the current data submission. The default (false) is to append to the existing list.

Please be aware that setting replace to true for many data submissions will result in quite significant topology churn, and should be avoided unless absolutely necessary. For topology attributes that change moderately frequently, please consider using observations instead.

A good example of a topology attribute for which you would want to replace an existing list would be the list of mounted files systems on a host. This does not change very often and when it does, there is no reason to retain the old values in the current data view.

Parameters:
replace - Whether or not the value should replace (true) or append to (false, default) the existing values in the server.
Since:
5.5.5.1

setSampleValue

void setSampleValue(java.lang.Boolean value)
Sets the value of this node as a boolean. Boolean values are converted to text using Boolean.toString() and stored as text. The value set can be retrieved with getValueText(). Setting this will remove any previously set numeric value.

Parameters:
value - The boolean value to set.

setSampleValue

void setSampleValue(java.util.Date value)
Sets the date value for this node. Dates are converted to to timestamps using Date.getTime() and treated as numbers. The value set can be retrieved with getValueNumber(). Setting this will remove any previously set text value.

Parameters:
value - The date to set.
See Also:
getValueDate()

setSampleValue

void setSampleValue(java.lang.Number value)
Sets the numeric value for this node. The value will be converted to a Double by the server. Setting this will will remove any previously set text value. The unit will default to "count".

Parameters:
value - The numeric value for this element.

setSampleValue

void setSampleValue(java.lang.Number value,
                    UnitService.Units unit)
Sets the numeric value for this node. The value will be converted to a Double by the server. Setting this will will remove any previously set text value.

Parameters:
value - The numeric value for this element.
unit - The unit for the number, if null, defaults to "count"

setSampleValue

void setSampleValue(java.lang.String text)
Sets the text value for this element. Doing so will remove any previously set numeric value.

Parameters:
text - The text value for this element. Theoretically, there is no limit to the size of text that can be included, but please consider the impact on the server before you submit the entire O.E.D., translated into Klingon.

setSampleValue

void setSampleValue(java.lang.String text,
                    UnitService.Units unit)
Sets the text value for this element. Doing so will remove any previously set numeric value.

Parameters:
text - The text value for this element. Theoretically, there is no limit to the size of text that can be included, but please consider the impact on the server before you submit the entire O.E.D., translated into Klingon.
unit - The unit associated with this sample value.

setValueFrequency

void setValueFrequency(long frequency)
Sets the rate which will be reported to the server. If no rate is defined for this value, then the rate is inherited from its parent.

Parameters:
frequency - The sample collection rate that will be reported to the server.

setValueTimestamp

void setValueTimestamp(long timestamp)
Sets the timestamp associated with this value. If not set, the value's timestamp will be inherited from its parent.

Parameters:
timestamp - The timestamp for this value, in milliseconds since the Epoch. This must be in local machine time and will be adjusted to compensate for time drift between the client and the server.
